definitions.definition: A small building, or a room within one, for the remains of the dead , with walls, a roof, and (if it is to be used for more than one corpse) a door. It may be partly or wholly in the ground (except for its entrance) in a cemetery , or it may be inside a church proper or in its crypt . Single tombs may be permanently sealed; those for families (or other groups) have doors for access whenever needed.
A pit in which the dead body of a human being is deposited.

main_definition: A small building, or a room within one, for the remains of the dead , with walls, a roof, and (if it is to be used for more than one corpse) a door. It may be partly or wholly in the ground (except for its entrance) in a cemetery , or it may be inside a church proper or in its crypt . Single tombs may be permanently sealed; those for families (or other groups) have doors for access whenever needed.
secondary_definitions: ( loosely ) A pit in which the dead body of a human being is deposited.
